API Reference

This section provides detailed information about the code structure, modules, and APIs of the JSW Bellary BF2 Vibration Monitoring System.

Table of Contents

  • System Architecture

  • Module: app.py

    • Class: VideoProcessor

  • Module: cam.py

    • Class: CamConnect

    • Class: CameraThread

  • Module: plc.py

    • Class: PLC

  • Module: database.py

  • Module: logging_config.py

  • Module: file_verifier.py

  • API Usage Examples

System Architecture

The Vibration Monitoring System consists of multiple interconnected modules, each responsible for specific functionality:

Module: app.py

The main application module that coordinates all components and implements the core vibration detection algorithm.

Class: VideoProcessor

class VideoProcessor(mes_score=50, fps=10, video_duration=180, stable_threshold=1, motion_blur=True)

Main class for processing video frames and detecting vibrations.

Parameters:

  • mes_score (int) – Threshold for motion energy score to detect vibrations

  • fps (int) – Frames per second for video processing

  • video_duration (int) – Duration of recorded video in seconds

  • stable_threshold (int) – Threshold for determining stability in seconds

  • motion_blur (bool) – Enable/disable motion blur detection

Methods

load_storage_limit(self)

Loads storage limit from configuration file.

Returns:

Storage limit in GB (default: 30GB)

Return type:

int

Example:

storage_limit = processor.load_storage_limit()
print(f"Storage limit: {storage_limit} GB")
check_storage(self)

Checks available disk space against the configured limit.

Returns:

True if sufficient space, False if below limit

Return type:

bool

Example:

if processor.check_storage():
    # Proceed with recording
else:
    # Display warning or stop recording
load_roi(self)

Loads Region of Interest (ROI) configuration from file.

Returns:

ROI configuration as dictionary

Return type:

dict

Example:

roi = processor.load_roi()
if roi:
    x, y, width, height = roi['x'], roi['y'], roi['width'], roi['height']
add_camera(self, cam_serial_num, rtsp_path)

Adds and initializes a camera connection.

Parameters:

  • cam_serial_num (str) – Camera serial number identifier

  • rtsp_path (str) – RTSP URL for camera connection

Example:

processor.add_camera("CAM001", "rtsp://192.168.1.100:554/stream")
create_video_writer(self, output_path)

Creates a video writer object for recording.

Parameters:

output_path (str) – Path where video will be saved

Returns:

OpenCV VideoWriter object

Return type:

cv2.VideoWriter

Example:

writer = processor.create_video_writer("path/to/output.avi")
mse(self, image_a, image_b)

Calculates Mean Squared Error between two images.

Parameters:

  • image_a (numpy.ndarray) – First image for comparison

  • image_b (numpy.ndarray) – Second image for comparison

Returns:

MSE value

Return type:

float

Example:

error = processor.mse(gray_frame1, gray_frame2)
if error > threshold:
    print("Motion detected")
lighting_compensation(self, frame)

Applies histogram equalization to compensate for lighting variations.

Parameters:

frame (numpy.ndarray) – Input BGR image

Returns:

Histogram equalized grayscale image

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

compensated = processor.lighting_compensation(frame)
overlay_logo(self, frame, logo, position=(10, 10))

Overlays a logo on the frame.

Parameters:

  • frame (numpy.ndarray) – Target frame to overlay logo on

  • logo (numpy.ndarray) – Logo image

  • position (tuple) – Tuple of (x, y) coordinates for logo placement

Returns:

Frame with overlaid logo

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

frame_with_logo = processor.overlay_logo(frame, logo_img, (20, 20))
put_title(self, frame, title)

Adds a title text to the frame.

Parameters:

  • frame (numpy.ndarray) – Target frame to add title to

  • title (str) – Text to display as title

Returns:

Frame with title

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

processor.put_title(frame, "Vibration Monitoring System")
put_motion_notification(self, frame, text)

Adds vibration status notification text to the frame.

Parameters:

  • frame (numpy.ndarray) – Target frame to add notification to

  • text (str) – Notification text

Returns:

Frame with notification

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

processor.put_motion_notification(frame, "Vibration Detected!")
show(self, name, frame)

Displays frame in a window.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Window name

  • frame (numpy.ndarray) – Frame to display

Example:

processor.show("Camera Feed", frame)
start_video_recording(self, video_writer, frame_raw)

Writes a frame to video recording.

Parameters:

  • video_writer (cv2.VideoWriter) – OpenCV VideoWriter object

  • frame_raw (numpy.ndarray) – Frame to write to video

Example:

processor.start_video_recording(writer, frame)
process_frame(self, frame_raw, logo, frame_gray)

Core function for processing each frame for vibration detection.

Parameters:

  • frame_raw (numpy.ndarray) – Original unprocessed frame

  • logo (numpy.ndarray) – Logo image to overlay

  • frame_gray (numpy.ndarray) – Grayscale version of frame

Returns:

Processed frame

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

processed_frame = processor.process_frame(frame, logo, gray_frame)
manage_video(self)

Manages video recording file creation and path.

Returns:

Current time string in format “HH:MM:SS”

Return type:

str

Example:

current_time = processor.manage_video()
process(self)

Main processing loop for the application.

Example:

processor.process()

Functions

load_config()

Loads application configuration from file.

Returns:

Tuple of (mes_score, fps, video_duration, stable_threshold, motion_blur)

Return type:

tuple

Example:

mes_score, fps, video_duration, stable_threshold, motion_blur = load_config()

Module: cam.py

This module handles camera connections and frame acquisition.

Class: CamConnect

class CamConnect(cam_address)

Manages connection to a camera via RTSP.

Parameters:

cam_address (str) – RTSP URL for camera connection

Methods

grab_frame(self)

Thread function to continuously grab frames from camera.

Example:

# Called internally
import threading
thread = threading.Thread(target=camera.grab_frame)
thread.start()
reconnect_camera(self)

Attempts to reconnect to camera after connection loss.

Returns:

True if reconnection successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example:

if not camera.reconnect_camera():
    print("Failed to reconnect to camera")
read(self)

Returns the current frame from camera.

Returns:

Current frame or error image if unavailable

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example:

frame = camera.read()
cv2.imshow("Frame", frame)
release(self)

Releases the camera connection.

Example:

camera.release()

Class: CameraThread

class CameraThread(camera_serial_number, rtsp_link, frame_dictionary)

Thread class for handling camera operations in parallel.

Parameters:

  • camera_serial_number (str) – Serial number identifier for camera

  • rtsp_link (str) – RTSP URL for camera connection

  • frame_dictionary (dict) – Shared dictionary to store frames from multiple cameras

Methods

run(self)

Main thread function that continuously captures frames.

Example:

# Called by starting the thread
camera_thread.start()
stop(self)

Stops the thread execution.

Example:

camera_thread.stop()

Functions

load_camera_config()

Loads camera configuration from data/cameras.json.

Returns:

Dictionary mapping camera serial numbers to RTSP URLs

Return type:

dict

Example:

camera_config = load_camera_config()
for serial, url in camera_config.items():
    print(f"Camera {serial}: {url}")

Module: plc.py

This module handles communication with the Programmable Logic Controller.

Class: PLC

class PLC

Manages connection and communication with the PLC.

Methods

convert_ma_to_percentage(self, ma)

Converts milliamp readings to percentage (range: -12mA to 20mA → 0% to 100%).

Parameters:

ma (float) – Current in milliamps

Returns:

Percentage value

Return type:

float

Example:

percentage = plc.convert_ma_to_percentage(15.5)
print(f"Current percentage: {percentage}%")
connectToPLC(self)

Establishes connection to PLC via Modbus ASCII protocol on COM7.

Returns:

True if connection established, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example:

if plc.connectToPLC():
    print("Connected to PLC")
else:
    print("Failed to connect to PLC")
read_bit(self, address)

Reads a value from the specified PLC register.

Parameters:

address (int) – Register address

Returns:

Value read from register

Return type:

int

Example:

value = plc.read_bit(4106)
print(f"Register value: {value}")
write_bit(self, address, data)

Writes a value to the specified PLC register.

Parameters:

  • address (int) – Register address

  • data (int) – Value to write

Returns:

True if write successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example:

success = plc.write_bit(4106, 200)
if success:
    print("Value written successfully")

Module: database.py

This module handles database operations for storing vibration events.

create_db_if_not_exists()

Creates the PostgreSQL database if it doesn’t exist.

Example:

create_db_if_not_exists()
create_table_if_not_exists()

Creates the “vms” table if it doesn’t exist.

Example:

create_table_if_not_exists()
store_vibration_stopped_time()

Records the timestamp when vibration stops.

Example:

store_vibration_stopped_time()

Module: logging_config.py

This module configures the application-wide logging system.

setup_logger()

Configures a logger with TimedRotatingFileHandler.

Returns:

Configured logger object

Return type:

logging.Logger

Example:

logger = setup_logger()
logger.info("Application started")

Module: file_verifier.py

This module handles file verification to ensure required files exist.

verify_config_files()

Checks for the existence of all required configuration files.

Returns:

Boolean indicating if all required files are present

Return type:

bool

Example:

if verify_config_files():
    print("All configuration files found")
else:
    print("Missing configuration files")
create_directories()

Creates necessary directories if they don’t exist.

Example:

create_directories()

API Usage Examples

# Initialize camera system
camera_config = load_camera_config()
frame_dict = {}
camera_threads = []

# Create camera threads
for camera_serial, rtsp_url in camera_config.items():
    camera_thread = CameraThread(camera_serial, rtsp_url, frame_dict)
    camera_threads.append(camera_thread)
    camera_thread.start()

# Process frames
while True:
    for camera_serial in camera_config
